title: What are the differences between an IIT and an NIT? - Quora

response.answer_text: I think I can answer this one as I was an NITian last year but Now I am an in IIT. My all analysis will be based on IIT Delhi and NIT Warangal as these are the Institutes I have been a part of. Students & Course Curriculum : They may not become equal at any point of time as the level of students IITs possess is no doubt better than NITs. NITs also have very good students but that is always the second choice of students in India.One would like to go to an NIT if he didn't get a good IIT. Also, the level of studies in IITs is far more wider and higher level as compared to an NIT. The network of teaching assistants in IITs is better than an NIT. Hostels :- Hostels in NITs are new but they are not run by the student bodies. There are no positions like Maintenance secretaries and Representatives as IITs have ( talking about IIT Delhi). Extra Curriculars :- The sense of competition in IITs for extra Curriculars is damn too high as compared to NITs. There are hostel competitions and trophies in IITD which compells everyone to make efforts in Sports and Extra Curriculars.Talking of IITD,Clubs in IITD are more active and have representatives for each culture from every hostel. That means one or two representatives each for Drama, dance,literary club,Music,Quizzing, Hindi Samiti, Student welfare committee. That sums upto 10 students from each hostel in every year. That means 130 students of a year have Position of Responsibilities in cultural extra Curriculars. Every hostel has a band and a dance group, they practice and need to take part in the inter hostel competitions. Sports Culture: The sports in IITs are also more encouraged and All IITs have more developed football,Cricket,hockey, athletics ground which is at par than most NITs. In Some IITs, it is even compulsory to play one sport. Also, each hostel have a vice captain of 2nd year and a captain from 3rd year and a team for every sport, which makes IIT very good in terms of sports. As a result of which, the level of Inter IIT and Inter NIT is quite different. Research:- The professors at IITs focus also on research a lot as compared to NITs. Startups Culture and Placements :- IITs are no doubt excelling in giving out Startups and better Core and Non Core placements. IITs have produced some of the best startups ever like Flipkart etc. Infrastructure: The infra in IITs, the mailing system(the webmail) , the management of studies and putting everything on online portal (moodle) is something which would take NITs years to develop. Exposure : The exposure that the student in IITs gets is far more than he will get in any NIT.

Since this is a sensitive topic and I don't want the legion of IITains/NITians (or any other colleges per se) teaming up on me, I'll answer this by sharing my personal experience with a tinge of light humor.  Let's start with 2 contrasting incidences dear to me, before getting bogged down in the finer comparison between the two.  Incidence 1: I used to travel by train when I returned home from my college (Trichy to Vadodara). So, I used to get a chance to interact with many people. From my experience, most north indians don't know much about NITs. Most of conversations that I have had were like: . Uncle: Tum kahan padhte ho? (Where do you study?) Me: I am in 2nd year Mech. I study at NIT Trichy. Uncle (poker face): Yeh trichy kahan hai. (Where is this place?) Me: Woh train change karna padta hai. Chennai se 300km door hai. (It is 300 km away from Chennai and requires me to change trains) Uncle: Ohh.. Madras se b door. have to change trains and it is 300 km from Chennai. IIT k alawa b bahut acche college hai. Waise Madras mein mera Bhanja padta hai SRM mein.. Bhaut achha college hai.. Tumne to naam suna hoga..Bahut hoshiyar ladka hai..(Ohh! Even further from Madras. There are good colleges other than IITs. Btw, my nephew studies in SRM. It is a nice college. You must have heard it's name. He is a bright kid.)  Me (cursing myself for choosing NIT-T and not IIT): Bahut achha hai SRM (SRM is a really nice college).  Incidence 2: I was lucky enough to get selected from college for internship at TATA Steel, Jamshedpur. The following conversation happened between me and my guide (head of Mech Maintenance) when I met him for the first time. Me: Good morning sir. May I can come in? Guide: Yes, you may. How's weather here? It is your first time here. Me (nervously): Yes. The weather here is humid and hot. And, I have not been to JSR before. Guide: Why don't you introduce yourself? (So, I told him about my college and branch and my hobbies. We were allotted the projects by HR and I was a bit worried about how will I solve a real life industrial problem with the very little knowledge I possess and shared this with him) Guide: You will do it. Don't worry about it. You should be confident. You are from such prestigious institute. It's good to have you here.  I left his room with an imaginary pat on my back and a huge smile on my face. I have never seen someone showing me such respect just by knowing my college name. But the reality is only those people know about NITs who really work with NITians. Later I came to know that almost all chief (my guide's bosses are NITians). Even the CEO of TATA Steel, Chairman of Tata Group are NIT-T Alum.  Expectations vs Reality People will see me with respect as I am from top NIT. This is rarely the situation as most people don't know about NITs (Even I didn't know NIT-Trichy is in Tamil Nadu before I decided to join it). Even my uncle (who lives in village) thinks that I could not bag a good college in my state and had to join some private college 2000km away.Top NITs are comparable to some old IITs. Although this may be true in some cases, but IITs like Bombay, Kanpur, Delhi and others are way out of any NIT’s league. The education there is simply better. Period. (Even after 3 years of graduating, I still believe old 5 IITs are way ahead)My college Tees will make me an instant celebrity. I will be a chick magnet and girls will follow me on twitter, quora, instagram and FB. Girls don't usually like 'nerd' guys and for them the IIT/NIT tag doesn't matter. So, it is usually the other way around.People treat NITians the way they treat others. As most people don't know about NITs, unlike IITs which have recently gained widespread publicity due to the exponential growth of Jee coaching centres, it is really difficult for an NITian to get recognition as you will always be considered second. But, this doesn't mean that NITians don't get respect. They get utmost respect from the corporate world, especially from those who have worked with NITians before. Thanks.!

Disclaimer: It's a funny conversation between me and my friend. This conversation is not posted to hurt anyone's sentiments. If it hurts you then it is purely co-incidental. MY FRIEND WAS PREPARING FOR IIT'S. AND THIS CONVERSATION IS OF YEAR 2012. BASIC INTRODUCTION I had done diploma in Engineering, so basically I was not aware of IIT'S/NIT'S back then.So there was my best friend who was preparing for JEE-Advance/Mains.Lets say his name is U. CONVERSATION : After having random conversations Me: Hey U! How's your preparations going on?U: It's good but I'm tensed a bit.Me: Why what's the problem?U: You know Ashish how badly I want an IIT and I can't compromise my college other than IIT.(He was in 11th std and he got to know about IIT's from his friends) Me: Come on Yaar. Chill! You are so intelligent that you can easily get a top Government local college. You don't need to be tensed.(He had got his 1st sem result of 11th Science with a whooping 86% which was not easy at all) U: Yaar. You don't understand if I graduate from IIT I'll get crores of package.Me: Oh I see (I was dumbstruck as I'm used to hear the rupees maximum in lakhs only)Me: Okay U! Just for information which college comes after IIT'S?U: It's NIT'S.(He had already told me the full form of IIT so I was eager to know the full form of NIT) Me: So what is the full form of NIT??U: ITS NON-IIT'S.Me: But you told only NIT, there is only single I in it.U: Yeah! They only write single I instead of two.Even he was confused between NIT/NIIT. But yes, he did got IIT and presently he graduated from IITG batch of 2019.

On Quora: An IITian guy profile 4 answers with <100k views Followers >1k An NITian guy profile 19 answers with > 650k views Followers < 250  During marriage of an IITian/NITians (if he is from Bihar, UP) Dowry of an IITian: 25 lakhs+ Dowry of an NITian: 15 lakhs+  In an Occasion (what an IITians deals with): Uncle x : kaha pdhte ho beta? (Where do you study, son?) IITian guy: IIT y me hu (i am in IIT y) Uncle x: Refreshment mila beta ya lau?( you have your refreshment or should I bring?) Uncle x: Branch konsi hai beta?( and your branch,son?) Here if you are a non-cse IITian guy then you will certainly observe change in Uncle x gestures or you will be listening an unnecessary advice. In an Occasion (what an NITian deals with): Uncle x: kaha pdhte ho beta?(where do you study, son?) NITian guy: NIT z me hu( i am in NIT z) Uncle x: Refreshment le lena beta or mujhe bhi lana( Have your refreshment and bring me the refreshment too)  In friend circle: Friend(don't know much about IITs/NITs): Engineering ke lie toh sbse acha IIT hi hota na? Engineering kro toh IIT se hi ( IITs are the best college for engineering, no? If you have to persue engineering then do it from there only) After knowing that the friend with whom he is telling is from an NIT Friend: abe sale, ab kya chahiye, NIT me ho. Life set hai bc ( wtf, what else you need ? You are in an NIT,your life is set)  After 2-3 years of passing out from IITs/NITs: Recruiters to an IITian: we don't care much about your IIT tag. Tell us your skills please. Recruiters to an NITian: we don't care about your NIT tag.Tell us your skills.  Suggest me some more differences i'll add here :)

IIT's are superior than NIT's being different in the following ways: - Ranking. IIT's fills most of the slots in the list of top 15 colleges in India for   Engineering Top 100 Engineering Colleges in India whereas most of the NIT's occupy the slot after that. - Requirement for Admission. For Bachelors one has to have very good rank in IIT-JEE(said to be the toughest of all exams in the world) and also good marks in 12th standard for IIT whereas NIT give admission on the basis of AIEEE ranks. - Students- As said above when you have tough screening policy for admissions you are supposed to get filled with top students. At this point I would also like to mention students in NIT's are good as well because to get into NIT's you need to have higher ranks in AIEEE which is competitive enough. So i would give equal marks to both of them in this respect. - The quality of professor, IIT's have best engineering faculty in India. I am not saying NIT's doesn't have good professor but we are trying to be relative here. - Amount of research work, IIT's have good amount of research work being carried out jointly by professors and students. They do projects for esteemed institution like ISRO, DRDO, BARC etc. Even NIT's do research with them but not at the same magnitude.  - Infrastructure and Funding. IIT's have better Infrastructure with spacious campus, good research labs etc. and are well funded by centre government.  - IIT is globally known, any college accepting Indians as students would have heard of IIT this may or may not be the case with NIT's. - Placements- Top Notch companies prefers IITian's over NITian's and also salaries are well differentiated. Sorry mate but I cant find any point on which NIT's can beat IIT's. IIT is like Mecca for engineering students.

IIT= Indian Institute of Technology NIT= National Institute of Technology that’s the difference. just kidding!! IIT’s are the most reputed technological institutes of the country, upholding their never diminishing prestige for decades. they are the homes of one of the finest minds in the country and are always among the dreams of especially class 11 and 12 students who opted science without biology. they are internationally recognized by many organisations and getting a seat their is based on the toughest engineering exam in the country JEE ADVANCED.(as on 2017) NIT’s are REC’s(regional engineering colleges of 20th century) turned to national institutes governed by the MHRD and union government, the admission process is through the second most toughest engineering exam in the country JEE MAIN, (as on 2017) and they are considered to be the consolation prizes for not getting IIT’s by some!!! …It is also nationally and internationally recognised and reputed and considered the second to next IIT (although different NIT’s have different prestiges and quality, only the best ones are good) so these are the differences, the similarities are basically more than the differences, but this should give you a brief idea but in any sense prestige of all IIT’s >> prestige of any (top) NIT . hope you have got your answer.

There is lot of differences you can find while studying in these institutions such as 1.IIT has better brand value in India as well foreign as compared to NIT. 2.Quality of teaching in top IIT are very popular as you know about the Nptel lectures are IIT made where as in some NIT it is also comparable to those IIT but numbers are few. 3.placements are far better in top IITS and you have more global exposure but when I talk about Indias top brand company there is package difference of 1 lac to 1.5 lac as compared to NIT. 4.you are provided with good instruments which will help you if you want to pursue research work which is lagging in NIT. 5.campus area & facilities are provided more to IIT students as compared to NIT. 6.but the competition when you enter in NIT is more as these students are more possessive bcoz they just missed the chance to enter IIT. 7.when I talk about my NIT there is very good competitive environment as lot of students secure top positions in exams like gate (All India rank 1 many times) , cat and gre. So never to lose hope as you did not made into IIT as NIT is one of the good supplements of IIT. Students thinking are nearly same so opportunities to grow is comparable.

A2A. You are judging institutions by the salary which people earn after graduating from these institutes. Understand this very simple fact, the IITs and NITs provide only the opportunity to sit for top companies. It's your hard work that gets you through placement in turn leading to a higher package. One more thing, the package you are talking about is associated with IT and CSE guys(in general) only. In other branches, the situation remains same. You may want to inquire about the packages for other branches in IITs and NITs(I am sure you will be surprised).  One thing I can say for sure is the alumni network of IITs are much stronger.Their alumni have done excellent work till now and are at key positions in the industry. Thus they play a key role in bringing so called "high paying companies" to their respective campuses. This fact is true for NITs as well. Also, the selection process in any of the programs at IIT,in general, ensures that only qualified and hard working people enter there. These student are then groomed by the best faculties.(Current and ex-IIT students may or may not agree to this fact).The opportunities(research internship/PHD from a foreign university) you get at an IIT are unmatched with any NIT(exclude the top 3). As far as culture is concerned, again the IITs have inter-IIT sports meet as well as big cultural and technical fests which encourages interaction among students as well.For example, MOODi is cultural fest of IIT Bombay which everyone knows.

First of all….. The basic difference is IITs are INDIAN INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY & NITs are NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY. And all of us know this basic difference. Now going for some technical reasons: admission in IITs based on JEE ADVANCED score while getting admission in NITs is based on JEE MAINIITs are superior than NITs in every aspect (except some new IITs)IITs don’t have state quota while NITs do have 50% state quota.Now coming to the differences which common people don’t know (only a NITian or IITian will tell you these things) after getting into NIT, the first thought is “yaar aur thoda padh leta to IIT me chala jata”Neighbours, Relatives and all other people don’t know much about NITs and they keep asking “beta, IIT nhi mila kya” (kid, didn’t you get admission in IIT)and there are many more regrets being an NITian but afterall NITs are also good colleges and Better than newer IITs. so these are some differences between NITs and IITs . keep reading!

Well, buddy Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) is of course better then National Institute of Technology (NIT) but this statement is not applied for all IIT and NIT.Some of the IIT is far better then any NIT like IIT BOMBAY IIT KANPUR IIT DELHI IIT KHARAGPUR IIT MADRAS These all are quite good as compared to any NIT .but some of top NIT which is as good as some of lower ranking IIT. IITs have produced some of the best startups ever like Flipkart etc. Infrastructure: The infra in IITs, the mailing system(the webmail) , the management of studies and putting everything on online portal (moodle) is something which would take NITs years to develop. Sports Culture: The sports in IITs are also more encouraged and All IITs have more developed football,Cricket,hockey, athletics ground which is as par than most NITs. In Some IITs, it is even compulsory to play one sport. Also, each hostel have a vice captain of 2nd year and a captain from 3rd year and a team for every sport, which makes IIT very good in terms of sports. As a result of which, the level of Inter IIT and Inter NIT is quite different. Research:- The professors at IITs focus also on research a lot as compared to NITs. HOPE YOU LIKE IT AND IT WILL HELP U ):

IIT-Indian Institute of Technology NIT-National Institute of Technology So let me tell you the difference between the two. Every year around 12lakhs of PCM(physics,chemistry,mathematics) students from CBSE and all the state boards appear in the H.S(+2) examination. Around 10lakhs students fill up the forms of JEE Mains. From which around 3.6 lakhs students get selected and get into NIT’s which are all over our country,probably every state has an NIT. Now from this 3.6 lakhs the students who qualify for JEE ADVANCE, appear for it. From them the top 20 thousand(appx.) Students get into IIT’s. There were only 7 IIT’s in India.Now around 23 are There. so I guess I was able to make you understand the difference! Thank you! Hope to see you in a IIT champ :)

There are few differences No of expert teachers in certain domain will be lesser at NIT compare to IIT.Research facility will be less at NIT compare to IITConnection of founder/ceo will be less at NIT compare to IITCampus area will be lesser in NITit might not be true with all IIT/NIT though Lets take VLSI facility at NIT Nagpur and IIT Bombay in 2010 No of experts teacher in VSLI at NIT were 7 , IIT Bombay had more than 20NIT Nagpur had characterization lab (few IIT/NIT have it), all VLSI tools , but doesn’t have fab facility , IIT Bombay have all those, also they have fab facilityMore IIT alumni are founder/CEO ,Even NIT Nagpur have decent number of CEOs/Founder’sCampus Area of NIT Nagpur is around 210 acres , where campus of IIT Bombay is around 550I really enjoyed NIT Nagpur , but a yes there few are things , which we had to compromise is.. like exposure to fab facility .. mems fabrication ..but there is collaboration of NIT Nagpur to IIT Bombay , one can do fabrication at IIT Bombay, few PHD candidates were doing it.

IIT stands for the Indian Institutes of Technology, which are the most elite tech schools of the country. They admit students based on the JEE Advanced, supposedly the toughest exam in the world. They have world class facilities and infrastructure. Placements are great and companies pay hefty packages to recruit IITians because they are perceived to be the best engineers in India and possibly the world. NIT stands for National Institutes of Technology. These we formerly called Regional Engineering College. Though not as good as IITs, they are also excellent Institutes for Engineering. They have a grant money lesser than IITs which in most cases results in a lower level of infrastructure and facilities as compared to an IIT. They admit students from the JEE Main.

*****IITs and NITs***** Both NITs and IITs are Institutes of National Importance. Both are highly prestigious and are always in limelight due to the exceptional students studying in them. Difference is that the IITs have the top creamy layer of academically strong students. Just the very next layer of such students is in NITs. As a result the government raises tremendously high funds for research work in IITs as compared to NITs. The other thing that comes is recognition, many multinational companies visit only IITs for placements, they don't know any other Institute except IITs in India. What comes next is the alumni network,IITs have globally widespread and highly acclaimed alumni, as compared to NITs. But, at the end of the day, your hard work will only be the key to your success. Being in an IIT will just give you a bit more boost and support to start your career. Hope this helps!

People’s reaction to IITs and NITs are.. Mera beta ‘IIT ‘ jayega… ( our son will go to IIT) Le NITIANs: hum mein kaun si kami h?( what is the fault in us?)  ————————————————————————————— People who know least about engineering colleges.. When you tell someone you are doing engineering from IIT…  On the other hand when you tell the same people that you are from NIT… Their reaction be like… Is NIT private or govt. College?? Outer You:  Inner You:  Then you explain them that NITs are like IITs and some nits are much better than new iits 😎 Btw i hope you enjoyed reading my content..😘😘 Divyanshi Agrawal

If you look at a glance then you can make out that there is not much difference between them but IITs grab the highlight. When we talk about the opportunity then you will find that IITs consider students matching their criteria 100% whereas NITs give you chance to show your talent by giving spot round admission. NIT Jalandhar, NIT Patna and NIT surat are such institutes who give opportunity to candidates who qualified the exam even if their minimum criteria is not matching (or matching) and if they couldn't get into IITs. They believe that if a candidate has qualified our exam then certainly he is capable of doing something good.Academic cost in IITs is low as compared to NITs. This difference is due to fund provided by central government to IITs is sufficient enough to manage everything well. Funding to NITs is little less as compared to IITs.Placement opportunities also contribute a little difference. Above all points don't play any role if you are smart and innovative.It is not necessary that every IITian and NITian is smart. Your knowledge and application dictates the term. Be optimistic..

Its huge difference between both of these institute Both have high value in market and respect in society Difference: Iits have their Brand name in another CoUntries but not forNits are for those who have average IQ and average speed but IIT are for those who have brilliant IQ. and Great speed with accuracyIits required more hardwork than NitsOur society prefers iitians over nitsAnd now time for u to be iitian go and best of luck buddyThanks for reading and please upvote if you find helpful,❤️❤️❤️

It is obvious to say that the educational standards of IITs are far better than NITs as they cover a course from scratch to the end. The outstanding Teachers of IITs have different & innovative teaching styles that benefit candidates with an extremely new and interesting version of learning. As far as the difference between IIT and NIT in terms of Educational Programs is concerned, both stand at the same position. After the completion of the first year, it is mandatory for every student of both the Institutes to undertake a course from other departments like – Humanities, Social Sciences & Management. Difference between IIT and NIT can be counted in every aspect even if we talk about the subjects & courses offered by these institutes, you can see which one holds your desired subject.

Sincerity The students are more sincere.The professors are more sincere.The authorities are more sincere.The staff is more sincere.About the IITs, the Ministry is more sincere.Studies are more sincere.Projects are more sincere.Hence Companies are more sincere while chosing IITs to hunt for talent.Coaching Centres are more sincere about IITs.Parents are more sincere about their kids making it to IITs.So you see its all about one important word 'Sincerity'. The sincere you are the better it gets. :) Hope this helps!!!

I am from neither, but I have cleared both JEE Mains(AIR 16k) and JEE Adv(AIR 9000). I do not know whether I am qualified to answer this question or not, and I’ll try to answer this from a distance and according to what has been reported. Both IITs and NITs are known for the brilliance of its students. Both JEE Advanced and JEE Mains are examinations which are prepared over a year of time by experts. They are highly efficient for the selection process. However, JEE Mains checks more of the concepts and speed of problem-solving, while JEE Advanced checks Higher-Order Thinking ability of an aspirant. Here comes the difference, a person can excel in JEE Mains if he/she knows all the concept by heart and can give quick responses to relevant questions asked, but a person can excel in JEE Advanced if he/she can visualize and go beyond what has been taught.Only IITs have got top QR world rankings, but no NIT has a place in QR rankings for Engineering colleges. QR rankings are quite an authentic source for judging the brilliance of an institute.

The difference of first letter says everything. Indian seems to depict 'of India' whereas National is 'of nation'. As IITs are built to bring technological advancement for India, NITs are meant for regional development. That's why NITs have home state quota to promote regional growth. This makes a huge difference in every aspect. IITs get huge funding in comparison to any of the NITs. As IITs are face of India, faculty and student welfare are well taken care of. and many more…..but at the end of the day, what matters is the outcome and not merely the name.

Work Ethics. I have been fortunate enough to study in both of the prestigious institutes of India. I can tell you from my experience that the kind of efforts you have to put in IIT to compete and excel is far greater compared to NIT. Academics wise, you will find coursework outdated in many top NIT and Of course, I don't have to explain about placements. If you are not branch specific person, I would strongly recommend IITs(All old and some new) over NITs(All top).

IITs get funding from central government whereas the NITs get funding from the state governments they are present in. So the endowments for NITs are usually lower than IITs.  Also, IITs are superior in terms of education, placements and research. Getting into IITs is relatively tough too. But some top NITs like Surathkal, Warangal and Trichy can be considered equal to top IITs.

The only difference is that IIT being a national level institute is better and has more infrastructure facilitites. Also since it is a deemed university the quality to education and facility is better. Whereas the NIT is a regional level institute and is not at par with IIT's but again it depends on which branch you are taking. The NIt's are affiliated to the regional universities ( by now they are deemed) and hence not as autonomous as IIT.  But having said that some of the NIT's are very good too.

First of all IIT stands for Indian institute of Technology and NIT stands for National Institute of Technology.IIT’s are considered as most premiere institutions of India. To get admission into NIT's you have to clear JEE MAINS only, but to get admission into IIT's you have to first clear JEE MAINS and then JEE ADVANCED with a good rank.There are 23 IIT's and 31 NIT's. The placements records in both institutions are very very good. So score as much marks as possible to get admissions into these institutions.Also there is 50% home state quote in NIT, but there is no home state quota in IIT.

IIITs are regarded as the best engineering institutes in India.NITs are treated as the second best engineering institutes in India.Next come IIITs.All the institutes offer the same degrees after completion of the courses.To join IIT/ NIT/ IIIT first you have to appear in JEE main and after being qualified in JEE main you can take JEE adv which is the sole entry route to IIT.If on the other hand you can score decent marks in JEE main you can join NIT/ IIIT.Dreams of all the engineering aspirants are to join IITs but only 10k+ can get entry to IIT.

I don't think there's much difference. … I ve seen enough in iit roorkee and I will say one thing… there are people who did incredible things… and there are ones who never came out of leaves and flowers… It's all abt what you are up to… may it be nit or iit.. they have similar profs… facilities. .. campus… (except new campuses) I feel there's a bit of hype created around iits…but one thing that iit can literally give you is an opportunity to be a part of the legacy Peace✌

Hey everyone, Starting with common society thinking there is an unnecessary hype of IITs and so demeaning the values that other colleges hold . In my opinion , society will not feed u after 5 or 4 years of bachelor your knowledge and college placements surely will. Regarding tech culture ,innovations , allumini network , placements, exposure,etc. Both top nits and iits hold nearly same place. Any college we choose to study should be on basis of where students of that particular college lands ,how much exposure that college offers . And these qualities definitely are there in both nit and iits Thanku

There is nothing like IIT , NIT and IIT differ in a numerous ways , For admission into NIT, u hv to scire well in JEE Mains (atleast 200 for a good NIT) . For an IIT , u got to score good in jee mains as well as jee advanced. You got to have constant motivation, patience and practice to get into a good college in India for those 2 ice breaking years of ur life (+1 and +2) Both are government colleges, but obviously IIT is way better than NIT.

Hello, The difference in IIT and NITs will mostly be reflected due to the faculty and level of students. Obviously, IITs have a more intensive programme, but NITs also give a good academic structure to the students. To know more about the difference, you will have to check individual IITs and NITs, as each institute in its own group also has its differences.

Bro actuallly the main difference btw NIT n IIT is not academics, academics is almost same. The major diff. is the kind of exposure u get, the facilities, the types of people u met, the experience u get from such things ………….which u cant get from NIT or any other college
The Main Difference Between NIT and IIT is the SALARY package given to the students. 2- The studying pattern is changed 3- Teaching professors 4- FEES and many more. .
Not is a college where as it is research institute
Brand value and the students.
